original_title: My ancestors just standing around, watching them invent everything..  — The Donald
article_summary: Discussion on historical inventions: Users debate the contributions of various cultures, with some criticizing figures like Muhammad and George Washington, while others highlight inventions by black Africans such as Anthony Mutua's electricity-generating shoes and Momolu Duwalu Bukele's Vai syllabary. The conversation also acknowledges the lack of documentation for many pre-colonial African inventions.</s>
